remarks:
A less restrictive version of the Separation Scheme ~ axsep , where variables ` x ` and ` z ` can both appear free in the wff ` ph ` , which can therefore be thought of as ` ph ( x , z ) ` .  This version was derived from the more restrictive ~ ax-sep with no additional set theory axioms.  (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2006.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.) 

---

 A less restrictive version of the Separation Scheme ~ ax-sep , where variables ` x ` and ` z ` can both appear free in the wff ` ph ` , which can therefore be thought of as ` ph ( x , z ) ` .  This version was derived from the more restrictive ~ ax-sep with no additional set theory axioms.  (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2006.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Nov-2016.)
statement:
axsep2 $p |- E. y A. x ( x e. y <-> ( x e. z /\ ph ) ) $.
$d ph y $.
$d x y z $.
